name: Live From Boston Garden
description: If you tuned into WGBH-Boston on the night of April 5, 1968 you didn't get to see the scheduled airing of Uncle Vanya starring Sir Lawrence Olivier. What you saw instead was an image that showed James Brown in mid-soul-reeling-screech and it read; voice of James Brown live from Boston Garden. It was the night after MLK was shot and most American cities were burning with riot and rage â€” All except Boston. Already scheduled to play the Boston Garden that night James agreed to air the concert on live TV in hopes that the opportunity to see him perform for free would entice mourners to stay home and lessen the threat of violence. It worked and not only was James credited with saving Boston but this moment hurled him into the National spotlight as the voice of black people everywhere. This is the hold graphic that momentarily took up the screen while TV crews scrambled to sync sound and image for the viewers at home. Hand printed off white on a black Hanes Medium weight Tee. Free domestic shipping!

name: Last of the White N-Word
description: Inspired by Norman Mailer's beat era poem, "The White Negro" famous rock critic Lester Bangs wore a shirt proclaiming himself, The Last of the White N-Words. In the most famous photo of him wearing the shirt his leather jacket covers most of the letters obscuring it's meaning. Inspired by Kate Simons photo my version lacks the letters her pic covered up. Read the entire story here--> Hand printed off white on a black Hanes Medium weight Tee. Free domestic shipping.

name: WRDW
description: When James Brown was growing up in Augusta, GA he shined shoes at a radio station. As he was coming up in the music business everyone told him he wouldn't get much further than the chitlin' circuit. They said his music just wasn't meant for mainstream airplay. As soon as James made some money he bought the station he used to shine at and reformatted it into a soul station so he could play his own records. There were a few artists that came before James who can be credited with bringing black music to white America but James Brown is the first to bring white America to black music. The radio station he did it at was WRDW 1480-am. Hand printed off white on a black Hanes Medium weight Tee. Free domestic shipping.
